name: booby
content:
booby

noun
 
/ˈbuːbi/
 
/ˈbuːbi/
(plural boobies)
jump to other results
  1. (informal) a stupid person
    • Don't be such a booby!
  2. [usually plural] (informal) a word for a breast, used especially by children
  3. a large tropical bird with brightly coloured feet that lives near the seaTopics Birdsc2
    4. Word Originsense 1 and sense 3 early 17th cent.: probably from Spanish bobo (in both senses), from Latin balbus ‘stammering’. sense 2 1930s: alteration of dialect bubby, of uncertain origin; perhaps related to German dialect Bübbi ‘teat’.
See booby in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: booby

name: booby prize
content:
booby prize

noun
 
/ˈbuːbi praɪz/
 
/ˈbuːbi praɪz/
jump to other results
  1. a prize that is given as a joke to the person who is last in a competition
    • The booby prize was awarded to the worst singer in the competition.
    compare wooden spoon
See booby prize in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: booby prize

name: booby trap
content:
booby trap

noun
 
/ˈbuːbi træp/
 
/ˈbuːbi træp/
jump to other results
  1. a hidden bomb that explodes when the object that it is connected to is touched
    • Nobody went near the abandoned car in case it was a booby trap.
    • a booby-trap device containing two kilos of explosives
  2. a hidden device that is meant as a joke to surprise somebody, for example an object placed above a door so that it will fall on the first person who opens the door
See booby trap in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: booby trap
